title: 113_hr3202
content: The Act is titled the "Essential Transportation Worker Identification Credential Assessment Act" and includes a comprehensive security assessment of the Transportation Security Card Program. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness in enhancing security for facilities and vessels. The assessment will evaluate how well the program addresses security risks in the maritime environment. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit an assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness in addressing security risks in the maritime environment. A corrective action plan with benchmarks and potential program reforms will be submitted to relevant committees for consideration. The Comptroller General will review the corrective action plan for the transportation security card program to assess its implementation of recommendations from national laboratories, maritime security centers, and previous Comptroller General recommendations. The Secretary of Homeland Security is prohibited from issuing a final rule on transportation security card readers until certain conditions are met. The Secretary of Homeland Security is restricted from issuing a final rule on transportation security card readers until specific conditions are met, including approval from the Comptroller General and an updated list of compatible card readers. This limitation does not apply to a final rule related to TWIC-Reader Requirements published by the Coast Guard in 2013. The Comptroller General will provide oversight on the implementation of the corrective action plan issued by the Coast Guard in 2013, reporting to relevant committees every six months for a 3-year period. No additional funds are authorized for this Act and its amendments, using existing amounts for implementation.
